instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .

threads.title: SOLVED <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - All works fine apart than keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Hi guys, got this board with slight water damage. Cannot see any oxidation on the board. 

After clean, all work well, however, when started there is no keyboard or trackpad detected.
USB both works fine. Also, the power button on the keyboard seems to be working too. 

Disconnected each one by one to check the other. Both are not working. 
Tried to swap the board into another case with the same keyboard, the keyboard still doesn't work.

Any advice what shall I measure first?

threads.title: SOLVED <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - All works fine apart than keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/02/04.
Be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high and <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> low.

threads.title: SOLVED <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - All works fine apart than keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Thank for the response [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] 
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> - HIGH
<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> - LOW

<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/2 - 0.02V 24 Ohm
<RESISTOR>R4804</RESISTOR> - 3.3V when board is on SMC bypass and 0V when board is connected to power but not turned on - 1.8 Ohm

threads.title: SOLVED <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - All works fine apart than keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Figured it out. <RESISTOR>R8114</RESISTOR> - <SIGNAL>TPAD_VBUS_EN</SIGNAL> must have been knocked off. Replaced it and have both now. 
Thanks for your help again.
